properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 2:28AM MST until February 3 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM MOVING IN SUNDAY MORNING...

.A low pressure system and accompanying cold front will bring
snow to the region today through late Monday morning. Areas along
the Nevada border will see snow and blowing snow which will impact
travel. The snow will taper off from west to east Sunday night
into Monday. The change in the advisory is to add the eastern
section of the western Magic Valley, basically from Jerome and
Twin Falls east to their respective county line. Snow will linger
there owing to a convergence zone, and we now expect 2 to 4 inches
of snow there between this afternoon and late Monday morning.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches, except 3 to 6 inches over the mountains. Winds gusting
as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Southern Twin Falls County zone.

* WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 11 AM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing
snow could reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM MST MONDAY
